info.title: CatalogObjectEntity Catalog API
info.description:
The purpose of the catalog is to store ProActive objects.

A catalog is subdivided into buckets.

 Each bucket manages zero, one or more
versioned ProActive objects.

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

parameters.name: sessionID
parameters.description: sessionID

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The name of the user who owns the Bucket

parameters.name: tenant
parameters.description: The name of the tenant that has access to the Bucket

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description:
The kind(s) of objects that buckets must contain.
Multiple kinds can be specified using comma separators

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: The Content-Type of objects that buckets must contain

parameters.name: objectTag
parameters.description: The tag of objects that buckets must contain

parameters.name: associationStatus
parameters.description:
The buckets must contain objects which have the given job-planner association status.
Can be ALL, PLANNED, DEACTIVATED, FAILED or UNPLANNED.
ALL will filter objects which have an association with any status.
UNPLANNED will filter objects without any association.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: The name of objects that buckets must contain

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The bucket name contains the value of this parameter (case insensitive)

parameters.name: projectName
parameters.description: Include only objects whose project name contains the given string.

parameters.name: lastCommitBy
parameters.description: Include only objects whose last commit belong to the given user.

parameters.name: committedAtLeastOnceBy
parameters.description: Include only objects have been committed at least once by the given user.

parameters.name: lastCommitTimeGreater
parameters.description: Include only objects whose last commit time is greater than the given EPOCH time.

parameters.name: lastCommitTimeLessThan
parameters.description: Include only objects whose last commit time is less than the given EPOCH time.

parameters.name: allBuckets
parameters.description: If true, buckets without objects matching the filters will be returned with objectCount=0. Default is false

parameters.name: sessionID
parameters.description: sessionID

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
The unique name of the Bucket.
The name of bucket can be between 3 and 63 characters long, and can contain only lower-case characters, numbers, and dashes.
A bucket's name must start with a lowercase letter and cannot terminate with a dash

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The name of the user that will own the Bucket. Defaults to GROUP:public-objects

parameters.name: sessionID
parameters.description: sessionID

delete.description: Note: it is forbidden to delete a non-empty bucket. You need to delete manually all workflows in the bucket before.

get.description: Note: Returns catalog objects metadata associated to the latest revision.

parameters.name: sessionID
parameters.description: sessionID

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description:
Filter according to kind(s).
Multiple kinds can be specified using comma separators

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: Filter according to Content-Type.

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.description: Filter according to Object Name.

parameters.name: objectTag
parameters.description: Filter according to Object Tag.

parameters.name: associationStatus
parameters.description:
Filter according to Job-Planner association status.
If enabled, only objects for which a job-planner association exists with the provided status will be returned.
Parameter can be ALL, PLANNED, DEACTIVATED, FAILED or UNPLANNED.
ALL will filter objects which have an association with any status.
UNPLANNED will filter objects without any association.

parameters.name: projectName
parameters.description: Include only objects whose project name contains the given string.

parameters.name: lastCommitBy
parameters.description: Include only objects whose last commit belong to the given user.

parameters.name: committedAtLeastOnceBy
parameters.description: Include only objects that have been committed at least once by the given user.

parameters.name: lastCommitTimeGreater
parameters.description: Include only objects whose last commit time is greater than the given EPOCH time.

parameters.name: lastCommitTimeLessThan
parameters.description: Include only objects whose last commit time is less than the given EPOCH time.

parameters.name: listObjectNamesForArchive
parameters.description: Give a list of name separated by comma to get them in an archive

parameters.name: pageNo
parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Page size

parameters.name: sessionID
parameters.description: sessionID

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the existing Bucket

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
Name of the object or empty when a ZIP archive is uploaded.
All objects inside an archive will be stored inside the catalog.

parameters.name: projectName
parameters.description: Project of the object

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: List of comma separated tags of the object

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: Kind of the new object

parameters.name: commitMessage
parameters.description: Commit message

parameters.name: objectContentType
parameters.description: The Content-Type of CatalogRawObject - MIME type

parameters.name: sessionID
parameters.description: The session id used to access ProActive REST server.

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the bucket where the catalog object is stored.

parameters.name: catalogObjectName
parameters.description: The name of the object in the bucket, which is the subject of the grant.

parameters.name: accessType
parameters.description:
The new type of the access grant.
It can be either noAccess, read, write or admin.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name of the user that is benefiting from the access grant.

parameters.name: sessionID

parameters.name: catalogObjectName

parameters.name: accessType
parameters.description: The type of the access grant. It can be either noAccess, read, write or admin.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name of the user that will benefit of the access grant.

delete.summary: Delete a user grant access for a catalog object

parameters.name: sessionID
parameters.description: The session id used to access ProActive REST server.

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the bucket where the catalog object is stored.

parameters.name: catalogObjectName
parameters.description: The name of the object in the bucket, which is the subject of the grant.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name of the user that is benefiting of the access grant.

put.summary: Update a user group grant access for a catalog object

parameters.name: sessionID
parameters.description: The session id used to access ProActive REST server.

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the bucket where the catalog object is stored.

parameters.name: catalogObjectName
parameters.description: The name of the object in the bucket, which is the subject of the grant.

parameters.name: accessType
parameters.description:
The new type of the access grant.
It can be either noAccess, read, write or admin.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description:
The new priority of the access grant. It can be a value from 1 (lowest) to 10 (highest), with 5 as default.
Priorities are used to compute the final access rights of a user belonging to multiple groups.
Group grants with the same priority will resolve with the default accessType order (admin > write > read > noAccess).
Finally, please note that a user grant has always more priority than a group grant.

parameters.name: userGroup
parameters.description: The name of the group of users that are benefiting of the access grant.

post.summary: Create a new group grant for a catalog object

parameters.name: sessionID
parameters.description: The session id used to access ProActive REST server.

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the bucket where the catalog object is stored.

parameters.name: catalogObjectName
parameters.description: The name of the object in the bucket, which is the subject of the grant.

parameters.name: accessType
parameters.description:
The type of the access grant.
It can be either noAccess, read, write or admin.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description:
The new priority of the access grant.
It can be a value from 1 (lowest) to 10 (highest), with 5 as default.
Priorities are used to compute the final access rights of a user belonging to multiple groups.
Group grants with the same priority will resolve with the default accessType order (admin > write > read > noAccess).
Finally, please note that a user grant has always more priority than a group grant.

parameters.name: userGroup
parameters.description: The name of the group of users that will benefit of the access grant.

delete.summary: Delete a user group grant access for a catalog object

parameters.name: sessionID
parameters.description: The session id used to access ProActive REST server.

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the bucket where the catalog object is stored.

parameters.name: catalogObjectName
parameters.description: The name of the object in the bucket, which is the subject of the grant.

parameters.name: userGroup
parameters.description: The name of the group of users that are benefiting of the access grant.

post.summary: Import an archive, either a plain zip or a ProActive Catalog package
post.description: Can either import objects from a plain zip archive, in which case the objects kind, project name and tags must be specified. Alternatively, a ProActive Catalog package can be imported, the various information will be obtained from the METADATA json file present in the package.

parameters.name: sessionID
parameters.description: sessionID

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the existing Bucket

parameters.name: isPlainZip
parameters.description: Plain zip instead of a Proactive package

parameters.name: commitMessage
parameters.description: Commit message. If empty, the message will either be empty for a plain zip or the commit message recorded inside the ProActive Catalog package.

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: Kind of the new object (only used when importing a plain zip)

parameters.name: projectName
parameters.description: Project of the package objects (Optional). If used with a ProActive Catalog package, will override all objects project names.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: List of comma separated tags of the objects (Optional). If used with a ProActive Catalog package, will override all objects tags.

post.summary: Export catalog objects as a plain zip archive or a ProActive Catalog Package
post.description:
Can either export catalog objects as a plain zip or as a ProActive Package containing the exported files along with a METADATA json file describing the exported objects.
Note: Returns catalog objects metadata associated to the latest revision.

parameters.name: sessionID
parameters.description: sessionID

parameters.name: isPlainZip
parameters.description: Plain zip instead of a Proactive package

requestBody.description: An optional json list of catalog object names to export. If not provided, the bucket will be exported fully.

404.description: Bucket not found or no object was found

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description:
The new priority of the access grant.
It can be a value from 1 (lowest) to 10 (highest), with 5 as default.Priorities are used to compute the final access rights of a user belonging to multiple groups.
Group grants with the same priority will resolve with the default accessType order (admin > write > read > noAccess).
Finally, please note that a user grant has always more priority than a group grant.
